item.title: Natalie add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "A half-read book is a half-finished love affair." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I talk about going to [George W. Bush's] Inauguration and crying when he took the oath, 'cause I was so afraid he was going to wreck the economy and muck up the drinking water'... the failure of my pessimistic imagination at that moment boggles my mind now." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I no longer drink nearly as much as I used to but, still, my motto is Sine coffea nihil sum. Without coffee, I'm nothing." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Just the other day, I was in my neighborhood Starbucks, waiting for the post office to open. I was enjoying a chocolatey cafe mocha when it occurred to me that to drink a mocha is to gulp down the entire history of the New World. From the Spanish exportation of Aztec cacao, and the Dutch invention of the chemical process for making cocoa, on down to the capitalist empire of Hershey, PA, and the lifestyle marketing of Seattle's Starbucks, the modern mocha is a bittersweet concoction of imperialism, genocide, invention, and consumerism served with whipped cream on top." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Natalie add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "If you show someone something you've written, you give them a sharpened stake, lie down in your coffin, and say, ‘When you’re ready’." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Rachel Maddow
item.description: "The single best thing about coming out of the closet is that nobody can insult you by telling you what you've just told them." -- Rachel Maddow

item.title: Natalie add a quote by C. Alexander London
item.description: "I'm a fan of the volcanic imagination. It bubbles and boils below the surface; it rumbles. When it erupts, continents are born." -- C. Alexander London

item.title: Natalie add a quote by C. Alexander London
item.description:
"I am still a bit mad at you for kidnapping me and putting our children's lives in danger."
"There's no how-to manual for parenting, Oggie. I'm doing the best I can." -- C. Alexander London

item.title: Natalie add a quote by John Rogers
item.description:
"There are two novels that can change a bookish fourteen-year old’s life: <i>[book:The Lord of the Rings|10254806]</i> and <i>[book:Atlas Shrugged|9365]</i>. One is a childish fantasy that often engenders a lifelong obsession with its unbelievable heroes, leading to an emotionally stunted, socially crippled adulthood, unable to deal with the real world. The other, of course, involves orcs."
[<i>Kung Fu Monkey -- Ephemera</i>, blog post, March 19, 2009]" -- John Rogers

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "It doesn't matter who you are or what you look like, so long as somebody loves you." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Suzan-Lori Parks
item.description: "The plays should have the half-life of plutonium." -- Suzan-Lori Parks

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Last night I dreamt I went to Manderley again." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Plato
item.description: "We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light." -- Plato

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Natalie add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Moonlight drowns out all but the brightest stars." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "When you light a candle, you also cast a shadow." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "In the light, we read the inventions of others; in the darkness we invent our own stories. " -- Alberto Manguel
